bug.short_desc: Improve error message if port of local source-server is occupied

long_desc.thetext:
Example: run the 'source-server' job, but the configured port is occupied:
*******************************************************************************************
$ ./generate.py source-server
---------------------------------------------------------------------------- Initializing: qxappwatch ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- >>> Processing configuration
---------------------------------------------------------------------------- Executing: source-server ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- <class 'socket.error'> :Traceback (most recent call last): File "generator.py", line 266, in <module> print >> sys.stderr, el[:300] TypeError: 'int' object is not subscriptable
*******************************************************************************************
The user should get an easy-to-understand message for the regular 'source-server' invocation. Btw, if started with the '-s' flag, it indeed says (after the verbose stacktrace info) "Address already in use".
With fixing bug#7093, this is also solved for all practical reasons.
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
